Martin Riggs.Action: Floors the car toward the heavily armed attacker despite risks, tries to lighten the mood by chanting with Murtaigh to will the attacker not to shoot.
Decides to run over a heavily armed and armored assailant using an unmarked police car despite the obvious risks.
Reassures his partner with a mix of humor and confidence, trying to keep morale high in a dangerous situation.
Dismisses his partner's legitimate concerns about the risk, relying primarily on hopeful thinking rather than a tactical plan.
Insists on drawing fire first to protect Murtaugh because he has less to lose.
Blames Murtaugh for their dangerous situation.
Throws the car wheel over to skid sideways under fire and effectively takes cover behind the wheels.
Quickly assesses the tactical situation and realizes there's no right turn possible.
Leads the offensive by deciding to draw the enemy's fire himself while instructing Murtaugh to run for cover, demonstrating tactical confidence and self-sacrifice.
Uses personal reasoning to argue why he should be the one taking the risk based on what he has to lose, showing clear-headedness in a stressful moment.
Shows a moment of distraction/unexpected emotional reaction upon learning that Murtaugh's wife is pregnant, indicating a momentary lapse in focus.
Shares sensitive personal news about Murtaugh's daughter being pregnant to prepare him, showing care and sincerity.
Explains an unusual plan to Murtaugh to save his life, urging him to trust him despite the awkwardness, demonstrating concern and trustworthiness.
Uses humor and informal tone to ease tension while instructing Murtaugh to undress to distract the enemy, showing ability to comfort and connect.
Formulates and explains a risky but clever plan to distract an enemy by having Murtaugh strip to draw attention, allowing Riggs to shoot a vulnerable valve on a napalm tank.
Demonstrates confidence in his plan and persuades Murtaugh to trust him despite the absurdity of the situation.
Jokes with Murtaugh about distracting the enemy with bird noises, showing playfulness and camaraderie.
Uses humor to motivate Murtaugh to cooperate in a dangerous plan.
Deliberately tricks Murtaugh to see if he would follow the distracting plan.
Gets to safety quickly along with Murtaugh when tanker falls from the sky, showing situational awareness and presence of mind.
Makes a light-hearted comment 'Never a dull moment, huh, Rog?' after a tense event, indicating confidence and calm under pressure.
Engages in playful teasing and light banter about the shark and Leo's presence on the boat.
Shows mild annoyance or confusion about Leo being invited, but it is framed in a casual, friendly context.
Engages in casual banter about the shark and its behavior, shows some awareness of the situation but no clear decisive action.
Questions why Leo was brought along and notes potential changes in life, showing situational awareness and foresight.
Attempts to grab Leo when he moves away from the shark, indicating responsiveness to immediate danger.
Admits to past pain about his deceased wife and reflects sincerely with Murtaugh about his current relationship status and unresolved feelings.
Uses sarcasm and dismisses traditional views on marriage initially when challenged by Murtaugh.
Shows restraint in discussing personal matters (he and Lorna haven't talked about marriage yet despite the baby being due), indicating complexity and possibly emotional distance.
Engages in a serious and honest conversation about his complicated personal life and his past, showing emotional depth and reflective thinking.
Avoids discussing marriage with Lorna despite the baby being due soon, indicating possible avoidance or lack of communication.
Maintains composure and introspection when confronted by Murtaugh about family values and his late wife.
Insists on following up on gunfire and potential trouble despite risks, showing concern for others' safety.
Tosses an illegally carried gun into the sea to prevent misuse.
Takes initiative to pursue possible danger to help someone in trouble.
Recognizes carrying a weapon without a permit is illegal and responsibly disposes of the gun by tossing it into the sea.
Is alert and quickly identifies the source of gunfire as the approaching freighter, showing situational awareness.
Immediately suggests pursuing the freighter to potentially help someone in trouble.
Moves to the helm and aggressively accelerates the boat to follow the freighter before Murtaugh intervenes.
Does not step back when Murtaugh takes over driving, shows flexibility and team cooperation.
Jokes with Leo by aiming laser sight at his nose and teasing about a mole.
Fires back at attackers to protect himself and Murtaugh during the freighter confrontation.
Insists on pursuing the fleeing lifeboat despite potential risk, persuading Murtaugh to follow.
Jumps aboard the bouncing lifeboat, surprising armed crewmen and immediately neutralizing two threats with precise gunfire.
Maintains composure and continues to shoot up into the air to avoid being hauled off without losing his hold.
Takes initiative to clearly declare 'You're under arrest' amid hostile environment, showing confidence in his authority.
Engages in multiple gunfights on the freighter, holding his ground under heavy fire and strategic pinning by an adversary.
Assesses angles quickly and uses a ricochet shot off the ship's metal gunwale to take out a gunman despite not being able to hit him directly.
Shakes off being knocked hard against a winch, keeping composure.
Gets K.O.'d by the ship's Captain after being caught off guard.
Finds his gun after recovering from attack, stands ready and alert immediately.
Aims his gun cautiously at new threat (the hatch opening), but lowers it upon seeing unarmed refugees, showing sound judgment.
Expresses concern and disbelief about the exploitation and suffering of the Chinese immigrants.
Engages thoughtfully in a conversation about human trafficking and labor exploitation, showing empathy.
No dismissive or cold remarks; listens and reacts seriously to the INS agent's description of the immigrants’ plight.
Asks intelligent, critical questions about the smuggling operation's economics, showing awareness and critical thinking about the situation.
Observes and processes the grim details of human trafficking and abuse, reflecting situational understanding and concern.
Momentarily distracted or uncertain when noticing Lee Butters approaching, failing to immediately recall the junior detective's name.
Engages in light teasing and camaraderie with Murtaugh and Butters, joking about Butters kissing Murtaugh's ass and calling him 'Burgers'.
Thanks Butters for bringing blankets despite being 'not happy', showing appreciation.
Shares critical information about a homicide with Butters in a straightforward way.
Expresses sympathy for innocent victims caught in violence and shows concern for 'some poor guy just trying to get through the shit'

Hesitates before starting the car, but ultimately starts it without incident; shows caution yet manages the task.
Arrives at home aching from injury but continues with normal activities, indicating resilience and perseverance.
Responds calmly and humorously when confronted with a gun at his head by his pregnant partner.
No indication that Riggs anticipates or prevents the crash involving Proody, suggesting possible lack of foresight or preventive action in this context.

Invites the dogs out and actively manages them by opening the door, demonstrating responsibility and capability.

Spots a flight of stairs and creatively uses a bench and a moving cart to vault to the first landing, quickly adapting to the environment to keep pursuit.

Coordinates with Murtaugh, telling him to stay with the Captain while he moves to intercept.
Struggles to hold on after a dangerous rooftop jump, urging himself to keep going despite the risk.

Leaps across a seventeen-foot gap between rooftops, showing daring physical skill and commitment to the chase.
After slipping off the edge, he manages to catch the ornate corner and attempts to hoist himself back up despite the danger and difficulty.
